intro: Gilia sapphirina, commonly known as the blue gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Gilia sapphirina is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and ease of growth.
